br.ufrgs.f180.elements
Class GameField

java.lang.Object
  br.ufrgs.f180.elements.GameField
All Implemented Interfaces:
VisualElement
public class GameField
extends java.lang.Object
implements VisualElement

This object merges the both physical simulation and visual representation of the game field. There are methods responsible for visual display as well as methods responsible for the physical phenomenas that guides the simulation. It is important to notice that visual representation of the logical field uses the following notation: (x, y) = (0, 0): this means the left bottom of the screen. Where x will increase from left to right and y will increase from bottom to top of the screen.

Author:
Gabriel Detoni

draw

public void draw(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.GC gc)
This method is responsible for drawing everything inside the field. It delegates to the elements to draw themselves. This method is invoked in a fixed interval and it is not bound to the physical simulation that is expected to occur much more frequently.

Specified by:
draw in interface VisualElement

getGoalDown

public double getGoalDown()
Returns the vertical position of the goal. As both goals have the same vertical position, this is a single method for both.

updateElementsState

public void updateElementsState(double timeElapsed)
This method is the central point of the physical simulation. It will go elements one by one and calculate its position relative to the amount time that was elapsed since the last invocation.

Parameters:
timeElapsed - the time elapsed since the latest invocation, in millis
